summary: Pleasing to the eyes without being so over-saturated that it hurts. Compatible with CoT.
descriptionHtml:
[center]
*ENSURE THAT YOUR MONITOR\'S GAMMA IS PROPERLY CALIBRATED [url=http://www.lagom.nl/lcd-test/gamma_calibration.php]HERE[/url]*

*USE [url=http://quickgamma.de/indexen.html]QUICKGAMMA[/url] IF YOUR MONITOR IS NOT CALIBRATED*
[line]
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/NIUEblF.jpg?1[/IMG]
[line]
ENB updated, try it out and tell me what you think!
[line]
If you like the preset, please consider leaving an endorsement :)
[line]
[color=#DEB887][size=8]Allure ENB[/size][/color]
[line]
*ENBSeries V0.119*
[line]
[OLD VERSION]
[SHOWCASE]---------------------------------------------[COMPARISON]
[youtube]NcmCDm1qH6w[/youtube][youtube]C2jfu6AGj1s[/youtube]
[line]
[color=#DEB887][size=8]Installation[/size][/color]
[line]
*For a more detailed install, check out the excellent guide written by Matso [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/25451/?tab=4&navtag=%2Fajax%2Fcomments%2F%3Fmod_id%3D25451%26page%3D1%26sort%3DDESC%26pid%3D0%26thread_id%3D805754&pUp=1]here[/url]*
[line]
1.) Add the following lines to SkyrimPrefs.ini located in \"C:\\User\\Documents\\My Games\\Skyrim\" under [DISPLAY] sections.

fGamma=1.0000
bFloatPointRenderTarget=1
bTreesReceiveShadows=1
bDrawLandShadows=1
bShadowsOnGrass=1
iMultiSample=0 
bTransparencyMultisampling=0 

2.) Extract all the files from the settings folder of your choice (HDR, CoT, etc.) to your Skyrim main install folder. To find your main install folder, right click your Skyrim shortcut and click \"Open File Location.\" This is your Skyrim install folder.

3.) Download the ENBSeries binary [url=http://enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0119.htm]here[/url] and extract d3d9.dll from the wrapper folder to your Skyrim install folder.

4.) Make sure brightness is set to MINIMUM in game.

5.) For a less intense DoF effect and better performance, use the LQ DoF in the \"Peformance Settings\" folder.

[line]
If you experience shadow flickering, try the following suggested by Aiyeen
[quote=\"Aiyeen\"]The flickering is due to a too small AO texture resolution relative to your monitor resolution. 
Increase the following in the enbseries.ini before starting the game. 
SizeScale and SourceTexturesScale. The SizeScale is the most vital, and also the one that hit performance the hardest. 
Do not go above 1.0 values around 0.7 will have removed just about all flickering.[/quote]

5.) Done! Shift + F12 to enable/disable ENB, Scroll_Lock to enable/disable SweetFX.
[line]
[color=#DEB887][size=8]Required Mods[/size][/color]
[line]
*Mods ENB was designed for*
[line]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/9930/?]Revamped Exterior Fog[/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/12454]Dark Dungeons for ENB[/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/4910]Dramatic Clouds[/url]
[line]
[color=#DEB887][size=8]Highly Recommended Mods[/size][/color]
[line]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/60/]EBT[/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/27043]Enhanced Lights and FX[/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/20801/]TPC[/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/24909]aMidianBorn Book of Silence[/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/15052/?]Apophysis Dragon Priest Masks[/url]

[line]
[color=#DEB887][size=8]Credits[/size][/color]
[line]
Kyokushinoyama for K ENB and Kyo Varients of MATSO ENB, you rock man!

Boris for ENBSeries, who made all this possible!

CeeJay.dk for SweetFX, thanks for the awesome, easy to use program!

mellophonist for BETA testing, thanks man!
[line]
[/center]
